required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incubator Weaning of Moderately Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Incubator Weaning of Moderately Preterm Infants: A Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this proposal is to evaluate whether weaning from an incubator to a crib at lower versus higher weight, 1600g or 1800g will result in shorter length of hospital stay among moderately preterm infants.
The hypothesis of this study is that length of hospital stay (from birth to discharge) will be decreased among moderate preterm infants weaned from an incubator to an open crib at a lower versus higher weight, 1600g vs. 1800g.

primary_outcome.measure: Length of Hospital Stay (LOS) From Birth to Discharge (up to 120 Days)
primary_outcome.description: Number of days the infant stays in hospital after birth until discharge home (up to 120 days).

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Stay (LOS) Following Weaning From Incubator to Crib to Hospital Discharge (up to 120 Days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of weaning from the incubator to crib through discharge (up to 120 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Among infants who were successfully weaned, the number of days in the hospital counting from the start of weaning from the incubator to the crib through discharge from the hospital (up to 120 days).

secondary_outcome.measure: Failure Rate of Weaning to Crib (Number of Infants With Axillary Temperature < 36.3°C After 2 Weaning Attempts)
secondary_outcome.description: Failure of wean is defined as axillary temperature less than 36.3°C after one hour in the crib on 2 successive readings, 3 to 4 hours apart, within 24 hours of weaning to the crib in spite of additional clothes/coverings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth Velocity (Weight in Grams/kg/Day) From Start of Weaning From Incubator (Following Random Assignment) to 36 Weeks Postmenstrual Age (PMA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of weaning from incubator through 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA)
secondary_outcome.description: Growth velocity in terms of weight (g/kg/day), considering infant weight at start of weaning from incubator to crib (following random assignment) and weight at 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Status (discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Infant weight at status is measured at the time of discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Status (discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Infant length at status is measured at the time of discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth Parameters: Head Circumference at Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Status (discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Infant head circumference at status is measured at the time of discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days.
Postmenstrual age (PMA) at discharge is the sum of the gestational age of the infant and its length of stay in hospital from birth to discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Readmission to the Hospital Within 1 Week of Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Number of infants re-hospitalized within 1 week (7 days) of discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Status (discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days)
Status (discharge, death, transfer to another facility, or 120 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of infants transferred to another non-Network hospital.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Stay (LOS) Following Randomization to Hospital Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days the infant stayed in hospital after randomization to the study until discharge.

arm_group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)
Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

intervention.intervention_name: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)
intervention.description: Infants will be weaned from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)

intervention.intervention_name: Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)
intervention.description: Infants will be weaned from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age 29 0/7 to 33 6/7 weeks at birth
- Birth weight less than 1600 grams
- Greater than 48 hours of age
- Current weight less than 1540 grams
- In an incubator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receiving phototherapy
- Receiving respiratory support (including CPAP, ventilation, HFNC > 2 LPM)
- Receiving blood pressure support
- Designated for transfer to referral hospital while in incubator
- Known major congenital or chromosomal anomaly

Brown University, Women & Infants Hospital of Rhode Island
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 1565 infants were screened for eligibility. 1199 infants were excluded. 680 were excluded due to not meeting all eligibility conditions, 510 did not get consent for randomization, and 9 were consented but not randomized due to parent (1 infant) or doctor withdrawal (1 infant), becoming medically unstable (3 infants) or other reasons (4 infants).

group.title: Lower Weight (1600 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)

group.title: Higher Weight (1800 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

baseline.population: A total of 366 infants were randomized in the study. 187 infants were randomized to the Lower Weight group. 179 infants were randomized to the Higher Weight group. The baseline statistics are based on the number of mothers or infants for whom data were available.

outcome.title: Length of Hospital Stay (LOS) From Birth to Discharge (up to 120 Days)
outcome.description: Number of days the infant stays in hospital after birth until discharge home (up to 120 days).
outcome.population: 185 infants in the lower weight group and 178 infants in the higher weight group have the date of discharge available.

group.title: Lower Weight (1600 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)

group.title: Higher Weight (1800 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

measure.title: Length of Hospital Stay (LOS) From Birth to Discharge (up to 120 Days)
measure.description: Number of days the infant stays in hospital after birth until discharge home (up to 120 days).
measure.population: 185 infants in the lower weight group and 178 infants in the higher weight group have the date of discharge available.

outcome.title: Length of Stay (LOS) Following Weaning From Incubator to Crib to Hospital Discharge (up to 120 Days)
outcome.description: Among infants who were successfully weaned, the number of days in the hospital counting from the start of weaning from the incubator to the crib through discharge from the hospital (up to 120 days).
outcome.time_frame: From start of weaning from the incubator to crib through discharge (up to 120 days)
outcome.population: There were 163 infants in the Lower Weight group that were successfully weaned from incubator to the crib; discharge date was missing for one of these infants. There were 159 infants in the Higher Weight group that were successfully weaned from incubator to the crib; 4 infants were missing start of weaning dates because of protocol violations.

group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)

group.title: Higher Weight (1800 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

measure.title: Length of Stay (LOS) Following Weaning From Incubator to Crib to Hospital Discharge (up to 120 Days)
measure.description: Among infants who were successfully weaned, the number of days in the hospital counting from the start of weaning from the incubator to the crib through discharge from the hospital (up to 120 days).
measure.population: There were 163 infants in the Lower Weight group that were successfully weaned from incubator to the crib; discharge date was missing for one of these infants. There were 159 infants in the Higher Weight group that were successfully weaned from incubator to the crib; 4 infants were missing start of weaning dates because of protocol violations.

outcome.title: Failure Rate of Weaning to Crib (Number of Infants With Axillary Temperature < 36.3°C After 2 Weaning Attempts)
outcome.description: Failure of wean is defined as axillary temperature less than 36.3°C after one hour in the crib on 2 successive readings, 3 to 4 hours apart, within 24 hours of weaning to the crib in spite of additional clothes/coverings.
outcome.population: 178 infants in the Lower Weight group and 167 infants in the Higher Weight group have the data on whether weaning from incubator to crib was successful after two attempts at weaning.

group.title: Lower Weight (1600 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a lower weight (1600 grams)

group.title: Higher Weight (1800 Grams)
group.description: Weaning from an incubator at a higher weight (1800 grams)

measure.title: Failure Rate of Weaning to Crib (Number of Infants With Axillary Temperature < 36.3°C After 2 Weaning Attempts)
measure.description: Failure of wean is defined as axillary temperature less than 36.3°C after one hour in the crib on 2 successive readings, 3 to 4 hours apart, within 24 hours of weaning to the crib in spite of additional clothes/coverings.
measure.population: 178 infants in the Lower Weight group and 167 infants in the Higher Weight group have the data on whether weaning from incubator to crib was successful after two attempts at weaning.

outcome.title: Growth Velocity (Weight in Grams/kg/Day) From Start of Weaning From Incubator (Following Random Assignment) to 36 Weeks Postmenstrual Age (PMA)
outcome.description: Growth velocity in terms of weight (g/kg/day), considering infant weight at start of weaning from incubator to crib (following random assignment) and weight at 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA).
outcome.time_frame: Start of weaning from incubator through 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA)
outcome.population: There were 257 (136 LW and 121 HW) infants who remained in the hospital at 36 weeks PMA that have weights measured at 36 weeks PMA. Twenty six infants (10 LW and 16 HW) who were still in the incubator at 36 weeks PMA and 20 infants (7 LW and 13 HW) missing the date of start of weaning were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Growth Velocity (g/kg/Day) After Transfer to Crib From Incubator to Crib to 36 Weeks Postmenstural Age (PMA)
outcome.description: Growth velocity in terms of weight (g/kg/day), considering infant weight at 24 hours after successful wean to crib and weight at 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA).
outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after successful wean to 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA)
outcome.population: 257 infants (136 LW, 121 HW) remained in hospital at 36 weeks PMA w/ weight measured at 36 weeks PMA. 26 (10 LW, 16 HW) were still in incubator at 36 weeks PMA, 31 (16 LW, 15 HW) were missing weight after 24 hrs of successful wean, and 4 (LW) w/ weights measured at 24 hrs after successful wean were missing date of 24 hr weight after successful wean

measure.title: Growth Velocity (g/kg/Day) After Transfer to Crib From Incubator to Crib to 36 Weeks Postmenstural Age (PMA)
measure.description: Growth velocity in terms of weight (g/kg/day), considering infant weight at 24 hours after successful wean to crib and weight at 36 weeks postmenstrual age (PMA).
measure.population: 257 infants (136 LW, 121 HW) remained in hospital at 36 weeks PMA w/ weight measured at 36 weeks PMA. 26 (10 LW, 16 HW) were still in incubator at 36 weeks PMA, 31 (16 LW, 15 HW) were missing weight after 24 hrs of successful wean, and 4 (LW) w/ weights measured at 24 hrs after successful wean were missing date of 24 hr weight after successful wean

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events are monitored from the time of randomization through 72 hours post study intervention completion. The study intervention period is defined as from the time of randomization to the end of a successful wean or failure.
reported_events.desc: Potential adverse events include inability to maintain temperature in crib, bradycardia, weight loss or lack of weight gain and feeding intolerance during the safety monitoring period.

certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigators must adhere to the Neonatal Research Network Publication policies.
